abstract: Philadelphia District Attorney Seth Williams says he will continue to fight against prison release of Msgr William Lynn, first Roman Catholic Church official ever charged with religious organization’s mishandling of sexual abuse cases; asks full State Superior Court to rehear case after Lynn’s conviction was overturned seven days ago.
lead_paragraph: Despite losing on appeal twice, Philadelphia’s district attorney said Monday that he would continue to fight to keep a Roman Catholic church official who will soon be eligible for parole in prison over his handling of sexual abuse cases.

headline.main: Pennsylvania: Prosecutor Wants Court to Reconsider Case Against Priest
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania: Prosecutor Wants Court to Reconsider Case Against Priest

snippet: Despite losing on appeal twice, Philadelphia’s district attorney said Monday that he would continue to fight to keep a Roman Catholic church official who will soon be eligible for parole in prison over his handling of sexual abuse cases.
